form_title.ms_form_title_llm_v1: Screeneded by NARA, 5/5/2023, Screening Form for Asylum Applicants

full_text: Screened by NARA, 5/5/2023 30. Are you entitled to return to country of issuance or your passport Yes No Travel document Yes No Or other document Yes why) No (If not, explain But I am afraid to return. 31. What do you think would happen to you if you returned? (Explain) I will be subject to persecution for the reasons set forth in this applications. 32. When you left your home country, to what country did you intend to go? U.S.A. 33. Would you return to your home country? Yes (No (Explain) I will not do so unless conditions change so that it is safe for me to return 34. Have you or any member of your immediate family ever belonged to any organization in your home country? Yes and are you still an active member. (If not, explain) relating to each organization: Name of organization, dates of membership or affiliation, purpose of the organization, what, if any, were your official duties or responsibilities, No. (If yes, provide the following information I was a member of IVU, (Institute of Urbing Housing) for 25 years. I was also a member of Catholic Church for 18 years. I used to have meetings with other members of the church and we would talk about the bible. FOIA (b)(6) 35. Have you taken any action that you believe will result in persecution in your home country? Yes No (If yes, explain) I used to work as a gardener for the IVU, (Instituto de Vivienda Urbana), the Institute of Urban Housing, this is a government organization. I was a member of the volunteer Civilian Patrols for 25 years. See declaration. 36. Have you ever been (detained interrogated convicted and sentenced imprisoned in any country? Yes No (If yes, specify for each instance: what occurred and the circumstances, dates, location, duration of the detention or imprisonment, reason for the detention or conviction, what formal charges were placed against you, reason for the release, names and addresses of persons who could verify these statements. Attach documents referring to these incidents, if any). I was detained on several occasions by soldiers while traveling in buses or while walking on the streets. They would ask for my cedula, (I. D. card) 37. If you base your claim for asylum on current conditions in your country, do these conditions affect your freedom more than the rest of that country's population? No (If yes, explain) Yes I was a member of the volunteer Civilian Patrols for 25 years. The guerrillas have threatened to kill Civilian Patrol volunteers. Many current and former members of the Civilian Patrols have been killed by the FMLN guerrillas in El Salvador. I am afraid to be killed also. 38. Have you, or any member of your immediate family, ever been mistreated by the authorities of your home country/country of nationality mistreatment because of Race Yes Religion Nationality No. If yes, was it Political opinion or Membership of a particular social group? Specify for each instance; what occurred and the circumstances, date, exact location, who took such action against you and what was his/her position in the government, reason why the incident occurred, names and addresses of people who witnessed these actions and who could verify these statements. Attach documents referring to these incidents 39. After leaving your home country, have you traveled through (other than in transit) or resided in any other country before entering the U.S.? 1 Yes No each country, length of stay, purpose of stay, address, and reason for leaving. and whether you are entitled to return to that country for residence purposes. (If yes, identify 40. Why did you continue traveling to the U.S.? Because this was my destination. 41. Did you apply for asylum in any other country? Yes-Give details No-Explain why not Other countries in Central America are not signatories to the protocol concerning refugees. (over)
